title: Data-Driven Linearization of Dynamical Systems
abstract: arXiv:2407.08177v2 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: Dynamic Mode Decomposition (DMD) and its variants, such as extended DMD (EDMD), are broadly used to fit simple linear models to dynamical systems known from observable data. As DMD methods work well in several situations but perform poorly in others, a clarification of the assumptions under which DMD is applicable is desirable. Upon closer inspection, existing interpretations of DMD methods based on the Koopman operator are not quite satisfactory: they justify DMD under assumptions that hold only with probability zero for generic observables. Here, we give a justification for DMD as a local, leading-order reduced model for the dominant system dynamics under conditions that hold with probability one for generic observables and non-degenerate observational data. We achieve this for autonomous and for periodically forced systems of finite or infinite dimensions by constructing linearizing transformations for their dominant dynamic

Title: 基于数据的动态系统线性化
摘要：arXiv:2407.08177v2 公告类型：替换交叉摘要：动态模式分解（DMD）及其变种，如扩展的DMD（EDMD），通常用于根据可观察数据拟合简单线性模型。虽然DMD方法在许多情况下表现良好，但在其他情况下表现不佳，因此澄清DMD适用的假设是必要的。更仔细地检查后，基于科尔曼算子对DMD方法的解释不够满意：它们只在高概率零概率事件下的假设下对DMD进行了辩护。在这里，我们给出了一个在原则上为线性化变换编的DMD方法，它提供了对主导系统动态的局部、主导级简化模型，这些条件在高概率概率下适用于典型观测数据和非奇异观测数据，适用于有限维或无限维自治系统和周期性驱动系统。通过为它们的初始数据构造线性化变换，我们实现了对动态模式的分解，即使在这些情况下，原始数据无法直接使用DMD方法。这是通过构造局部、主导级线性化来实现的，该线性化在有界条件下对动态模式进行有效拟合，并且考虑了数据的是指数增长的。这种方法为DMD和EDMD提供了更为严谨的解释，并且十分适合于减阶和预测动态系统的行为。
